meanings.definition: The act of retracting or the state of being retracted.
meanings.sent1: The retractions of the telescope allowed it to fit into a small case.
meanings.sent2: The retractions of the claws helped the cat climb down safely.
meanings.sent3: The retractions of the slinky toy made it look like a dancing spring.
meanings.sent4: The retractions of the turtle's head symbolized its shyness.
meanings.sent5: The retractions of the curtains revealed a stunning view of the city skyline.

meanings.definition: A statement or promise that is taken back or withdrawn.
meanings.sent1: She regretted her retractions of the invitation once she saw his disappointed face.
meanings.sent2: His retractions of support left the project without necessary funding.
meanings.sent3: The retractions of the apology only made the situation more awkward.
meanings.sent4: Her retractions of love felt like a stab in the heart.
meanings.sent5: The retractions of the promise shattered their trust in him.

meanings.definition: The act of pulling something back or in.
meanings.sent1: The retractions of the rope were smooth and controlled.
meanings.sent2: The retractions of the fishing line brought in a big catch.
meanings.sent3: The retractions of the vacuum cleaner cord were quick and efficient.
meanings.sent4: The retractions of the drawbridge signaled the end of the event.
meanings.sent5: The retractions of the dog's leash prevented it from running into the street.
